20:3.concept: Do not entertain thoughts of other gods besides G-d

22:21.concept: Do not cheat a foreigner monetarily
Do not insult or harm a foreigner with words

22:28.concept: Do not curse the head of state or leader of the Sanhedrin

20:5.concept: Do not worship idols in the manner they are worshiped
Do not worship idols in the four ways we worship G-d

20:4.concept: Do not make an idol for yourself

20:23.concept: Do not make human forms even for decorative purposes

23:13.concept: Do not turn a city to idolatry
Do not swear in the name of an idol

23:33.concept: Do not let idolaters dwell in the Land of Israel

23:25.concept: Serve the Almighty [traditionally: with daily prayer]

23:12.concept: Rest on the seventh day Sabbath

20:10.concept: Do not do prohibited labor on the seventh day Sabbath

35:3.concept: The court must not inflict punishment on the Sabbath

16:29.concept: Do not walk outside the city boundary on the Sabbath

20:8.concept: Sanctify the Sabbath (in speech) from beginning to end

12:15.concept: Destroy all leaven on 14th day of Nisan

13:3.concept: Do not eat leaven all seven days of Passover

12:20.concept: Do not eat mixtures containing leaven all seven days of Passover

13:7.concept: Do not see leaven in your domain seven days during Passover

12:19.concept: Do not find leaven in your domain seven days during Passover

12:18.concept: Eat unleavened bread on the first night of Passover

13:8.concept: Relate the Exodus from Egypt on the fIrst night Passover

30:13.concept: Each male Israelite must give a half shekel annually

12:2.concept: The month of Passover (Nisan) shall be the first month

22:16.concept: The court must fine one who sexually seduces a maiden

21:28.concept: Do not benefit from an ox condemned to be stoned
The court must judge the damages incurred by a goring ox

22:31.concept: Do not eat meat of an animal that was mortally wounded

23:19.concept: Do not eat meat and milk cooked together
Set aside the first fruits and bring them to the Temple

34:26.concept: Do not cook meat and milk together

20:7.concept: Do not take G-d's Name in vain

12:48.concept: An uncircumcised priest must not eat food set aside for a priest
An uncircumcised male must not eat from the Passover lamb

13:13.concept: Redeem the firstborn donkey by giving a lamb to a priest
Break the neck of the donkey if the owner does not intend to redeem it

34:21.concept: The land shall rest unworked during the seventh year

23:11.concept: Leave free all produce which grew in the seventh year
23:11.category: καὶ ἔδονται οἱ πτωχοὶ τοῦ ἔθνους σου

20:25.concept: Do not build the altar with stones hewn by metal
20:25.category: οὐκ οἰκοδομήσεις αὐτοὺς τμητούς· τὸ γὰρ ἐγχειρίδιόν σου ἐπιβέβληκας ἐπ᾿ αὐτούς

20:26.concept: Do not climb steps to the altar

30:32.concept: Do not reproduce the anointing oil
Do not anoint a foreigner with anointing oil

30:37.concept: Do not reproduce the incense formula

30:9.concept: Do not burn anything on the Golden Altar besides incense

25:15.concept: Do not remove the staves from the ark

28:2.concept: The priests must wear their priestly garments during service

28:32.concept: Do not tear the priestly garments

28:28.concept: Do not loosen the breastplate from the ephod

30:19.concept: A priest must wash his hands and feet before service

29:33.concept: The priests must eat the sacrificial meat in the Temple
A non- priest must not eat certain sacrificial meat

25:30.concept: Make the show bread and place it before G-d

12:6.concept: Slaughter the paschal sacrifice at the specified time

23:18.concept: Do not slaughter the paschal sacrifice while in possession of leaven
Do not leave the fat of the paschal sacrifice overnight

12:8.concept: Eat the Passover lamb with unleavened bread and bitter herbs on the night of the 14th of Nisan

12:9.concept: Do not eat the meat of the Passover lamb raw or boiled
12:9.category: κεφαλὴν σὺν τοῖς ποσὶν καὶ τοῖς ἐνδοσθίοις.

12:46.concept: Do not take the meat of the Passover lamb from the confines of the group
Do not break any bones from the Passover lamb

12:43.concept: An apostate must not eat from the Passover lamb

12:45.concept: A permanent or temporary hired worker must not eat from the Passover lamb

12:10.concept: Do not leave any meat of the Passover lamb over until morning

22:5.concept: The court must judge the damages incurred by an animal eating

21:33.concept: The court must judge the damages incurred by a pit

22:6.concept: The court must judge the damages incurred by fire

22:1.concept: The court must implement punitive measures against a thief

20:17.concept: Do not covet and scheme to acquire another's possession

21:18.concept: The court must implement laws against the one who assaults another or damages another's property

23:5.concept: Help another remove the load from a beast which can no longer carry it

21:2.concept: Purchase a Hebrew slave in accordance with the prescribed laws

21:8.concept: The master must not sell his maidservant

22:10.concept: The courts must carry out the laws of a hired worker and hired guard

22:14.concept: The courts must carry out the laws of a borrower

22:7.concept: The courts must carry out the laws of an unpaid guard

22:25.concept: Lend to the poor and destitute
Do not press the poor and destitute for payment if you know they don't have it

23:2.concept: Decide by majority in case of disagreement
The court must not execute through a majority of one; at least a majority of two is required
A judge who presented an acquittal plea must not present an argument for conviction in capital cases

21:20.concept: The courts must carry out the death penalty of decapitation with the sword

22:18.concept: The court must not let the sorcerer live

23:7.concept: The court must not kill anybody on circumstantial evidence

23:6.concept: A judge must not decide unjustly the case of the habitual transgressor

23:1.concept: Judges must not accept testimony unless both parties are present

21:17.concept: Do not curse your father and mother

21:15.concept: Do not strike your father and mother
